text: Exhaust fan type, airflow, static pressure, voltage, and controls match schedule
Duct material, gauge, insulation, and layout match submittals and SMACNA/NFPA standards
Locations coordinated with architectural and structural elements, especially for garage or kitchen exhaust
Fan installed plumb and level, vibration-isolated, with backdraft damper if required
Toilet and general exhaust duct slope to fan/roof per spec; sealed, firestopped
Kitchen exhaust duct welded, sloped, continuous, grease-rated per NFPA 96
Garage exhaust ductwork low-leakage and fire-smoke dampers accessible and tagged
Roof/wall penetration flashed and sealed properly
Fans interlocked with lights (toilet), hoods and make-up air (kitchen), or CO sensors (garage)
CO/NO2 sensors installed per design, calibrated and interlocked to VFD/fans
BAS/DDC points connected: fan status, alarms, airflow, override
Airflow verified via TAB: each grille, hood, exhaust stack
Kitchen hood pressure test (grease duct) and airflow balance completed
Sound and vibration within acceptable limits
AHJ inspection and fire authority clearance passed for grease hood (if applicable)

id: • NFPA 90A, 96, SMACNA HVAC Duct Construction, ASHRAE 62.1, NECB 2020, NBC Part 6
• CSA C282 (Garage Fans/CO Interlocks), CAN/ULC-S649 (Grease Duct)
• Manufacturer Specs: Greenheck, Broan, CaptiveAire, Fantech, Loren Cook
